alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Henderson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 1:47PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Hancock, southwestern Henderson, south central Des Moines, central Lee and northeastern Clark Counties through 230 PM CDT... At 147 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Nauvoo, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Adrian around 200 PM CDT. Fort Madison, Niota and Colusa around 205 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Dallas City, Iowa Army Ammunition Plant and Carman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for southeastern Iowa.
